description: Change of use from offices (Use Class E) to six self-contained flat (Use Class C3) (Class MA, 56 day Prior Approval Process)
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: Development must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (5) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Daylight & Sunlight Study , NOISE IMPACT ASSESSMENT ISSUE 01 dated 5th February 2025 prepared by DAA GROUP, EX - 3D01, EX - 3D02, EX - L003, EX - P001, EX - P002, EX - P004, EX - E001, EX - E002, EX - E003, EX - E004, EX - S001, EX - S002, , , PLANNING STATEMENT FEBRUARY 2025 , PR- L003, PR- P001, PR- P002, PR- P004, PR- E001, PR- E002, PR- E003, PR- E004, PR- L002, PR- S001, PR- S002.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and Class O of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended.

| Any building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (6) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be based on an assessment of environmental noise levels from transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses, as measured outside any school holiday periods, and shall, as a minimum, achieve the sound insulation performance recommended by DAA Group in their Noise Impact Assessment report dated 5th February 2025 ISSUE 01. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal and external amenity noise levels shall not exceed the criteria set by BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units and neighbouring amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Separation of noise sensitive rooms from other uses

The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, bedrooms adjoining kitchen/living/dining/bathroom of separate flat, shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended ADE Building Regulations values, and by at least 10dB for bedrooms adjoining the communal corridor and staircase. As a minimum, the sound insulation performance of these separating walls shall achieve the performance recommended by DAA Group in their Noise Impact Assessment report dated 5th February 2025 ISSUE 01. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Separation of commercial uses and facilities from dwellings

The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating the commercial premises and facilities from habitable rooms shall be enhanced, based on an assessment of proposed commercial use and noise emission levels, by at least 10dB/ 15dB/ 20dB, as necessary above the recommended ADE Building Regulations value for residential use. The characteristics of any commercial noise source shall not exceed a Noise Rating level of NR20 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside habitable rooms. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1, 1.2 and E7.A.7 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan.

| Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
